rows.Tariff: No Fee (when no currency conversion is involved)

rows.Transfer Type: Transferring crypto to another PayPal or Venmo account
Transferring crypto to an address outside of PayPal or Venmo
rows.Fee: You will be charged a cryptocurrency network fee, payable in the crypto you transfer, which varies. For details on the network fee, see the PayPal Cryptocurrency Terms and Conditions. We will display such network fee right before you transfer any crypto.

rows.Transfer Type: Using PayPal as a funding source to buy and transfer crypto in one step to external cryptocurrency wallet providers who support this feature
rows.Fee:
When you buy crypto to be transferred in one step, you will also be charged a cryptocurrency network fee, payable in the crypto you transfer. The crypto amount to be transferred in one step to an external wallet plus the crypto amount you will be charged to cover the cryptocurrency network fee is the “combined cryptocurrency purchase amount.” We will display the network fee right before you transfer any crypto.
‎
For crypto other than PYUSD, you will pay (1) the transaction fee listed in the “Buying or selling a cryptocurrency” table above on the USD value of the combined cryptocurrency purchase amount and (2) 1% only on the USD value of the crypto that you transfer to your external wallet.
‎
For PYUSD, you will pay 1.5% on the USD value of the PYUSD that you transfer to your external wallet. You will not pay a transaction fee on the combined cryptocurrency purchase amount.

rows.Transfer Type: Using PayPal to transfer and sell crypto out of supported external cryptocurrency wallets in one step
rows.Fee:
When you transfer and sell crypto out of a supported external cryptocurrency wallet in one step, you will pay a transaction fee on the USD value of the crypto you are selling.
‎
‎For crypto other than PYUSD, you will pay (1) the transaction fee listed in the “Buying or selling a cryptocurrency” table above and (2) 1% only on the USD value of the crypto that you receive from your external wallet.
‎
‎For PYUSD, you will pay 1.5% on the USD value of the PYUSD that you receive from your external wallet. You will not pay a transaction fee listed in the “Buying or selling a cryptocurrency” table above.

rows.Activity: Bank Return on Withdrawal/Transfer out of PayPal
rows.Description: This fee is charged when a withdrawal/transfer out of PayPal is attempted by a user and it fails because incorrect bank account information or delivery information is provided.

rows.Activity: Credit Card and Debit Card Confirmation(s)
rows.Description: Some users, in order to increase their sending limit or as PayPal may determine, may be charged a credit card and debit card link and confirmation fee. This amount will be refunded when you successfully complete the credit card or debit card verification process.
